intro: Epilobium colchicum subsp. iranicum, commonly known as the Iranian willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to regions of Iran and Central Asia. It typically grows in moist, often calcareous soils and is often found in riverbanks, meadows, and wetlands. The plant features elongated, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink to purple flowers in racemes during the summer months. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants known for their ecological and ornamental value. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its arid and semi-arid habitats.
